item.title: Numerical systems and Boolean logic
item.description: Binary numerical system The Binary system is a base-2 numerical system that uses only two symbols: \(0\) and \(1\) . It’s the fundamental language of computers and is used to represent all types of data. In the Binary system, each digit represents a power of \(2\) , with the rightmost digit representing \(2^0\) , the next representing \(2^1\) , and so on.
